data.title: Canada in Brief
data.text:
Jump to section

The Basics

Fun Facts

PRODUCES 70% OF THE WORLD’S

MAPLE SYRUP

Home to some of the world's

best aurora viewing

Most donut shops

in the world (per capita)

Polar Bear capital

of the world

Province & Territory Facts

Explore the provinces and

territories to learn more.

Swipe through provinces and

territories to learn more.

Alberta

Population 4,067,175 Capital City Edmonton Largest City Calgary

Travel Times to Calgary

Los Angeles 3 hr 5 min Chicago 5 hr 30 min New York City 5 hr 25 min Boston 7 hr 25 min

Weather Average

Alberta enjoys a humid continental climate with warm summers and cold winters.

British Columbia

Population 4,648,055 Capital City Victoria Largest City Vancouver

Travel Times to Vancouver

Los Angeles 2 hr 50 min Chicago 4 hr 35 min New York City 6 hr 0 min Boston 8 hr 10 min

Weather Average

British Columbia has a number of different climatic zones. In general, temperatures are warmer in the south; rainfall is heaviest along the coast; and winters coldest in the interior.

Manitoba

Population 1,278,365 Capital City Winnipeg Largest City Winnipeg

Travel Times to Winnipeg

Minneapolis 1 hr 30 min Chicago 2 hr 20 min Los Angeles 5 hr 25 min San Francisco 5 hr 50 min

Weather Average

Manitoba has a moderately dry climate with sharp seasonal temperature changes. The summers are hot and winters are cold.

New Brunswick

Population 747,101 Capital City Fredericton Largest City Moncton

Travel Times to Fredericton

Boston 4 hr 10 min New York City 3 hr 50 min Chicago 4 hr 45 min Los Angeles 8 hr 0 min

Weather Average

New Brunswick has a typical continental climate with warm summers and cold winters, with slightly milder winters on the Gulf of St. Lawrence coastline.

Newfoundland and Labrador

Population 519,716 Capital City St. John's Largest City St. John's

Travel Times to St. John's

Boston 3 hr 45 min New York City 5 hr 20 min Chicago 5 hr 30 min Los Angeles 8 hr 50 min

Weather Average

Newfoundland and Labrador has a wide range of climates and weather, but broadly it has warm, humid summers and cold winters.

Northwest Territories

Population 41,786 Capital City Yellowknife Largest City Yellowknife

Travel Times to Yellowknife

Chicago 7 hr 45 min Los Angeles 9 hr 20 min New York City 10 hr 55 min Boston 10 hr 45 min

Weather Average

The mainland portion of the Northwest Territories has a subarctic climate, with short, cool summers and long, cold winters - perfect for aurora viewing.

Nova Scotia

Population 923,598 Capital City Halifax Largest City Halifax

Travel Times to Halifax

Boston 1 hr 20 min New York City 1 hr 45 min Chicago 4 hr 30 min Los Angeles 7 hr 45 min

Weather Average

Nova Scotia enjoys a maritime climate with warm summers and cold, wet and sometimes snowy winters.

Nunavut

Population 35,944 Capital City Iqaluit Largest City Iqaluit

Travel Times to Iqaluit

Boston 7 hr 25 min New York City 7 hr 45 min Chicago 11 hr 15 min Los Angeles 15 hr 30 min

Weather Average

Temperatures in Nunavut vary widely. In winter the days are short and cold, in the summer the Midnight Sun shines brightly over Nunavut with nearly 24-hour sunshine.

Ontario

Population 13,488,494 Capital City Toronto Largest City Toronto

Travel Times to Toronto

New York City 1 hr 25 min Boston 1 hr 25 min Chicago 1 hr 50 min Los Angeles 4 hr 35 min

Weather Average

Ontario has a continental climate, with hot summers and cold winters.

Prince Edward Island

Population 142,907 Capital City Charlottetown Largest City Charlottetown

Travel Times to Charlottetown

Boston 2 hr 55 min New York City 4 hr 30 min Chicago 4 hr 45 min Los Angeles 9 hr 5 min

Weather Average

Prince Edward Island has a moderate climate that is strongly influenced by the surrounding seas with warm summers and cold winters.

Quebec

Population 8,164,361 Capital City Québec City Largest City Montréal Major Airports

YQB (Québec)

YUL (Montréal)

Travel Times to Montréal

New York City 1 hr 10 min Boston 1 hr 10 min Chicago 1 hr 55 min Los Angeles 5 hr 15 min

Weather Average

Quebec has wide temperature variations. In the south, the weather is continental, with four seasons varying from hot summers to cold, snowy winters with lots of rain. The central and northern regions have longer, colder winters and shorter cooler summers.

Saskatchewan

Population 1,098,352 Capital City Regina Largest City Saskatoon

Travel Times to Regina

Chicago 4 hr 30 min Los Angeles 5 hr 55 min New York City 6 hr 10 min Boston 6 hr 45 min

Weather Average

Saskatchewan receives more hours of sunshine than any other Canadian province. It experiences a humid continental climate with hot summers and very cold winters.

Yukon

Population 35,874 Capital City Whitehorse Largest City Whitehorse

Travel Times to Whitehorse

Los Angeles 7 hr 40 min Chicago 9 hr 0 min New York City 12 hr 15 min Boston 12 hr 20 min

Weather Average

The Yukon has a sub-arctic continental climate with shorter warm summers and very cold, dark winters - perfect for aurora viewing!
